block.p: Meaghan Maureen Shaughnessy, a daughter of Collette and Michael J. Shaughnessy of St. Paul, Neb., was married yesterday to Andrew Forrest Cahill, a son of Dr. Teena L. Cahill of Princeton, N.J., and Dr. James F. Cahill of Richboro, Pa. The Rev. David Cooper performed the nondenominational ceremony at Regis University in Denver.

Ms. Shaughnessy, 28, is keeping her name. She is to begin her third year at the University of Colorado School of Law in August. She graduated summa cum laude from Creighton University, and is a summer associate in the Denver office of Arnold & Porter, the law firm. Her father is a lawyer in private practice in St. Paul. Her mother is a coordinator of prevention education for the Central Nebraska Council on Alcohol, an organization in Grand Island, Neb.

Meaghan Maureen Shaughnessy, a daughter of Collette and Michael J. Shaughnessy of St. Paul, Neb., was married yesterday to Andrew Forrest Cahill, a son of Dr. Teena L. Cahill of Princeton, N.J., and Dr. James F. Cahill of Richboro, Pa. The Rev. David Cooper performed the nondenominational ceremony at Regis University in Denver.

Ms. Shaughnessy, 28, is keeping her name. She is to begin her third year at the University of Colorado School of Law in August. She graduated summa cum laude from Creighton University, and is a summer associate in the Denver office of Arnold & Porter, the law firm. Her father is a lawyer in private practice in St. Paul. Her mother is a coordinator of prevention education for the Central Nebraska Council on Alcohol, an organization in Grand Island, Neb.

Mr. Cahill, also 28, is the engineering manager for Soft Imaging Systems, a manufacturer of software and hardware for electron microscopes in Lakewood, Colo. He graduated from the University of Denver and received a master's degree in electrical engineering from the University of Colorado at Boulder. His mother is a clinical psychologist in private practice in Princeton. His father is the vice president for biopharmaceutical science, in Richboro, of Cato Research, a consulting firm. The bridegroom is a stepson of Ellen Cahill and of Brooks C. Dyer, who retired as a captain based in Newark for American Airlines.
